name: Smallest number k that is neither squarefree nor a prime power such that k is coprime to n.
comment: Let p be the smallest prime that is coprime to n and let q be the second smallest prime that is coprime to n. Then a(n) = p^2 * q.
Records in this sequence are set by n in A002110.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For k and m such that rad(k) = rad(m), a(k) = a(m), where rad = A007947.
example: a(12) = 175 = 5^2*7, since p = 5, q = 7, a(k) = 175 for n in A033845 (i.e., n such that rad(n) = 6).
a(20) = 63 = 3^2*7, since p = 3, q = 7, a(k) = 63 for n in A033846 (i.e., n such that rad(n) = 10).
mathematica: Table[c = 0; q = 2; Times @@ Reap[While[c < 2, While[Divisible[n, q], q = NextPrime[q]]; Sow[q^(2 - c)]; q = NextPrime[q]; c++] ][[-1, 1]], {n, 120}]
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=2); while (isprimepower(k) || issquarefree(k) || (gcd(k, n) != 1) , k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 01 2025
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 31 2025

name: Smallest composite squarefree number that is coprime to n.
comment: Let p be the smallest prime that is coprime to n and let q be the second smallest prime that is coprime to n. Then a(n) = p*q.
Records in this sequence are set by n in A002110.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For k and m such that rad(k) = rad(m), a(k) = a(m), where rad = A007947.
n < a(n) for n in A051250, a finite sequence whose largest term is 60.
example: a(12) = 35 = 5*7, since p = 5, q = 7, a(k) = 35 for n in A033845 (i.e., n such that rad(n) = 6).
a(20) = 21 = 3*7, since p = 3, q = 7, a(k) = 21 for n in A033846 (i.e., n such that rad(n) = 10).
mathematica: Table[c = 0; q = 2; Times @@ Reap[While[c < 2, While[Divisible[n, q], q = NextPrime[q]]; Sow[q]; q = NextPrime[q]; c++] ][[-1, 1]], {n, 120}]
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=2); while (isprime(k) || !issquarefree(k) || (gcd(k, n) != 1) , k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 01 2025
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 31 2025

name: Smallest number k that is powerful but not a prime power that is also coprime to n.
comment: Let p be the smallest prime that is coprime to n and let q be the second smallest prime that is coprime to n. Then a(n) = p^2 * q^2.
Records in this sequence are set by n in A002110.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For k and m such that rad(k) = rad(m), a(k) = a(m), where rad = A007947.
example: a(12) = 1225 = (5*7)^2, since p = 5, q = 7, a(k) = 1225 for n in A033845 (i.e., n such that rad(n) = 6), where rad = A007947.
a(20) = 441 = (3*7)^2, since p = 3, q = 7, a(k) = 441 for n in A033846 (i.e., n such that rad(n) = 10).
mathematica: Table[c = 0; q = 2; Times @@ Reap[While[c < 2, While[Divisible[n, q], q = NextPrime[q]]; Sow[q^2]; q = NextPrime[q]; c++] ][[-1, 1]], {n, 120}]
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 04 2025

name: Number of k < n that are coprime to n and neither squarefree nor prime powers.
comment: Let s = A126706, the set of numbers that are neither squarefree nor prime powers.
Let q(k) be the number of terms in A126706 that do not exceed k. For example, q(20) = 3, since s(1..3) = {12, 18, 20}.
a(n) = 0 for n < A382248(n). Only 72 numbers n are such that a(n) = 0, with n = 2310 the largest n such that a(n) = 0.
mathematica: nn = 120; q = 1; Table[Set[{c, i}, {0, 1}]; If[Nor[SquareFreeQ[n], PrimePowerQ[n]], t[q] = n; q++]; While[i < q, If[CoprimeQ[t[i], n], c++]; i++]; c, {n, nn}]
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 04 2025
